description._content: TITLE Griffin (Lamson) House, Keene NH CREATOR French, J.A., Keene NH SUBJECT Houses - NH - Keene Homes - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Stereograph of General Griffin's house, also know as the Lamson House. This is the site of the present post office. "Many houses of this type have been torn down in Keene within a few years in the so-called march of progress. This house was built by William Lamson in 1804, and afterward occupied by Gen. S.G. Griffin, and sold to the government for a post office site." The house was razed c.1910. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County DATE DIGITAL 20090708 DATE ORIGINAL 188? RESOURCE TYPE stereographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER HS051 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known copyright restrictions.
